title: Will a theory of everything be mathematical? - Quora

response.answer_text: It can be explained by module of symmetry space, similar to Euler solid of 2 dimensional space F+V-E=2, we can extend it to multi dimension by transfer into 2D space, n(n-1)(n^2–5n+18)/24 +1 for F, n(n-1)/2 for E, V for all point which two line intercept, F-E-V equal to dimension where it embed, for all n are odd number equal to 0, 16–10–5–1=0, 57–21–7*5–1=0,163–36–9*14–1=0, 386–55–11*30–1=0, 794–78–13*55–1=0 for n=5,7,9,11,13 as ch=2*3.14*gm^2 which’s solution of GR field equation by Schwarzschild’s static black hole from gm^2/l=mc^2 to l=gm/c^2=(hg/(2*3.14*c^3))^0.5 to ch, ch=El symmetry at Planck, proton, Atom scale compose a one and only one extra 6 dimensional calabi yau manifold for string theory fits our universe by 98–28–8*8=6, by super symmetry 137.036=gm^2/ke^2 unite QM with GR by 256–45–10*20=11 for n=10, 11D as ch=2*3.14*gm^2 as CFT, it’s ADS duality at 12D 562–66=496, 496-12*41=4 can transfer 10D into 4D(or 16D by module), ch symmetry at all scale can connect all fundamental constants, force of nature for theory of everything, instead of Planck’s mass m use prime number as it’s element, by all possible combination of prime it can solve all math problem too.

No hypothesis, upon which a theory is based, is mathematical. The mathematics allows the theory to make a quantitative prediction, which can be compared to experimental result. Compare a theory to a factory, mathematics to the machines that make a product (and even the raw material in some cases), and the product to experimental prediction. A theory of everything will at heart, have to make quantitative predictions, not just wave hands in the air and say, “It covers everything, trust me!”
